intro: Pentanema × vrabelyianum, commonly known as the hybrid pentanema, is a rare and naturally occurring hybrid plant resulting from the cross between Pentanema grandiflorum and Pentanema glabrum. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as woodlands or forest understories, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a hybrid species, offering insights into plant adaptation and genetic diversity in natural ecosystems.
